Ctrl+K
This is a community-supported SSVEP measure and aperiod analysis for EEG or other time series signal. If you'd like to contribute, check out our GitHub repository. Your contributions are welcome!

LoadDataLeeOne

Base class for loading and preprocessing SSVEP data.

Module Contents#

class scut_ssvep_aperiod.load_dataset.dataset_lee.LoadDataLeeOne(data_path, info_path='D:\\data\\ssvep_dataset\\MNE-lee2019-ssvep-data\\info_ssvep_lee_dataset.mat')[source]#

The time window for data processing, default is 4 - 0.14 seconds.

_get_info()[source]#

Gets the info from the info file.

_load_data_from_mat(pro_ica=True, filter_para=None, resample=None, picks=['P7', 'P3', 'Pz', 'P4', 'P8', 'PO9', 'O1', 'Oz', 'O2', 'PO10'])[source]#

Loads dataset from .mat file.

Parameters:

  • pro_ica (bool) – Whether to perform ICA in preprocessing.

  • filter_para (None or list) – Filter parameters, default is None (no filters). [low_freq, high_freq].

  • resample (None or int) – Factor for resampling, default is None (no resample).

  • picks (list) – Channels to select, default is [‘P7’,’P3’,’Pz’,’P4’,’P8’,’PO9’,’O1’,’Oz’,’O2’,’PO10’].

Returns:

Loads data into instance variables.

Return type:

None

_load_data_from_structure(file_data, pro_ica=True, filter_para=None, resample=None, picks=['P7', 'P3', 'Pz', 'P4', 'P8', 'PO9', 'O1', 'Oz', 'O2', 'PO10'])[source]#

Reads data from the structure in .mat file.

Parameters:

  • file_data (dict) – Data loaded from .mat file.

  • pro_ica (bool) – Whether to perform ICA in preprocessing.

  • filter_para (None or list) – Filter parameters, default is None (no filters). [low_freq, high_freq].

  • resample (None or int) – Factor for resampling, default is None (no resample).

  • picks (list) – Channels to select, default is [‘P7’,’P3’,’Pz’,’P4’,’P8’,’PO9’,’O1’,’Oz’,’O2’,’PO10’].

Returns:

Data split into shape (n_epochs, n_channels, n_samples). label (numpy.ndarray): Labels of the data. n_epoch (int): Number of epochs. n_channel (int): Number of channels. sample_rate (float): Sampling rate after resampling.

Return type:

split_data (numpy.ndarray)

_load_resting_state_data_from_mat(pro_ica=True, filter_para=None, resample=None, picks=None)[source]#

Load resting state dataset from a MAT file.

Parameters:

  • pro_ica (bool) – If True, performs Independent Component Analysis (ICA) during preprocessing.

  • filter_para (list or None) – Frequency filter parameters, specified as [low_freq, high_freq]. Default is None (no filters).

  • resample (int or None) – Resampling factor. If None, no resampling is performed.

  • picks (list) – Channels to select. Default is [‘P7’, ‘P3’, ‘Pz’, ‘P4’, ‘P8’, ‘PO9’, ‘O1’, ‘Oz’, ‘O2’, ‘PO10’].

Returns:

Preprocessed training and testing data for the resting state.

Return type:

tuple

_load_resting_state_data_from_structure(file_data, pro_ica=True, filter_para=None, resample=None, picks=None)[source]#

Reads resting state data from the structure in .mat file.

Parameters:

  • file_data (dict) – Data loaded from .mat file.

  • pro_ica (bool) – Whether to perform ICA in preprocessing.

  • filter_para (None or list) – Filter parameters, default is None (no filters). [low_freq, high_freq].

  • resample (None or int) – Factor for resampling, default is None (no resample).

  • picks (list) – Channels to select, default is [‘P7’,’P3’,’Pz’,’P4’,’P8’,’PO9’,’O1’,’Oz’,’O2’,’PO10’].

Returns:

Pre-resting state data. post_rest_data (numpy.ndarray): Post-resting state data.

Return type:

pre_rest_data (numpy.ndarray)

get_data(pro_ica=True, filter_para=None, resample=None, reconstruct_=False, reconstruct_type=0, freq_range=None, picks=['P7', 'P3', 'Pz', 'P4', 'P8', 'PO9', 'O1', 'Oz', 'O2', 'PO10'])[source]#

Retrieve and preprocess EEG data.

Parameters:

  • pro_ica (bool) – If True, performs Independent Component Analysis (ICA) during preprocessing.

  • filter_para (list or None) – Frequency filter parameters, specified as [low_freq, high_freq]. Default is None (no filters).

  • resample (int or None) – Resampling factor. If None, no resampling is performed.

  • reconstruct (str or None) – Reconstruction method. Options include: “remove_aperiodic”, “get_periodic”, “get_aperiodic”. Default is None (no reconstruction).

  • reconstruct_type (int) – Type of reconstruction phase invariance. Default is 0.

  • freq_range (None or list) – Frequency range for filtering. Default is None (no filtering).

  • picks (list) – Channels to select. Default is [‘P7’, ‘P3’, ‘Pz’, ‘P4’, ‘P8’, ‘PO9’, ‘O1’, ‘Oz’, ‘O2’, ‘PO10’].

Returns:

Preprocessed training and testing data along with their labels.

Return type:

tuple

get_data_resting_state(pro_ica=True, filter_para=None, resample=None, picks=None)[source]#

Get resting state data after preprocessing.

Parameters:

  • pro_ica (bool) – If True, performs Independent Component Analysis (ICA) during preprocessing.

  • filter_para (list or None) – Frequency filter parameters, specified as [low_freq, high_freq]. Default is None (no filters).

  • resample (int or None) – Resampling factor. If None, no resampling is performed.

  • picks (list) – Channels to select. Default is [‘P7’, ‘P3’, ‘Pz’, ‘P4’, ‘P8’, ‘PO9’, ‘O1’, ‘Oz’, ‘O2’, ‘PO10’].

Returns:

Preprocessed training and testing data for the resting state.

Return type:

tuple
